TITLE: Overwhelmed hospitals. Staffing shortages. Businesses closing. Here's how the Omicron wave is ravaging local communities
SUMMARY: Over the weekend, at least five metro Atlanta school districts announced they would shift to remote learning for the first week of the new year as students return to school after a holiday break that saw the Omicron variant spread even further out of control.

TITLE: The first snow of winter is coming for parts of the US South and Mid-Atlantic
SUMMARY: The first snow of the winter season is forecast for some areas across the South and Mid-Atlantic on Sunday and Monday.

TITLE: Defense Secretary Austin says he has tested positive for Covid-19
SUMMARY: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has tested positive for Covid-19 and is exhibiting "mild" symptoms, according to a statement from him released by the Defense Department on Sunday.

TITLE: One of the three missing people in the Colorado Marshall Fire has been accounted for, sheriff says
SUMMARY: One of the three missing people from the Marshall Fire in Colorado has been accounted for, Boulder County Sheriff Joe Pelle said in a news conference Sunday.

TITLE: Former Democratic leader Harry Reid to lie in state at US Capitol on January 12
SUMMARY: Former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid will lie in state in the US Capitol Rotunda on January 12, according to a joint statement from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, an honor given to few statesmen.

TITLE: One of Marjorie Taylor Greene's verified Twitter accounts permanently suspended
SUMMARY: Twitter has permanently suspended Georgia GOP Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's Twitter account @mtgreenee, the company confirmed to CNN Sunday morning.

TITLE: 'It's not a silver bullet': Democrats weigh how to talk about January 6 on the 2022 campaign trail
SUMMARY: The January 6 insurrection may be a year behind Rep. Jason Crow, but the Colorado Democrat -- and many of his colleagues -- insist it would be a grievous error for his party to downplay the attack.

TITLE: Trump-appointed FDIC chair to resign
SUMMARY: The Republican chair of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, who was appointed by former President Donald Trump, said on Friday that she intends to resign.

TITLE: Disney needs a comeback year. Will it get it?
SUMMARY: Disney did not have a magical 2021. Even as Covid-19 vaccines allowed countries around the world to lift restrictions, the company's business struggled. Attendance at its parks disappointed, and momentum from its Disney+ streaming service, once a bright spot, cooled off.

TITLE: Classic BlackBerry phones will stop working January 4
SUMMARY: You soon won't be able to use that old BlackBerry phone sitting at the bottom of your drawer somewhere.

TITLE: Here's what Elon Musk is likely to do with those billions of dollars in stock sales
SUMMARY: What's Elon Musk doing with the billions he's collected in the past two months from selling shares in Tesla?

TITLE: Tesla posts record fourth quarter and full year sales
SUMMARY: Tesla bucked the industry-wide trend of reduced sales due to the shortage of computer chips and other parts, posting record sales in the fourth quarter, up 71% from a year earlier.

AT&T, Verizon CEOs say they won't further delay 5G rollout near airports
SUMMARY: The chief executives of AT&T and Verizon Communications rejected a request to delay the planned Jan. 5 introduction of new 5G wireless service over aviation safety concerns but offered to temporarily adopt new safeguards.

TITLE: Wall Street is getting greedy again
SUMMARY: The calendar has flipped to 2022 but investors are still partying like it's 2021. Stocks remained near record levels Monday, the first trading day of the year, and investors are ramping up the greed.

TITLE: Little Caesars' Hot-N-Ready pizza no longer costs $5
SUMMARY: Not even Little Caesars is immune from price increases: The chain's signature $5 Hot-N-Ready pizza now costs 11% more.

TITLE: Aoife Beary, Berkeley balcony collapse survivor, dies aged 27
SUMMARY: Aoife Beary, one of the survivors of the 2015 Berkeley balcony collapse that killed six people, has died aged 27.

TITLE: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene says Facebook blocked her account for 24 hours
SUMMARY: Facebook has blocked Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene from posting on its platform for 24 hours, the Georgia Republican said Monday.

TITLE: 'We're staying open': Adams bucks teachers union request days into new administration
SUMMARY: Eric Adams has started his tenure as New York City mayor by rejecting a request from the city's largest teachers' union to temporarily move public schools to remote learning, capping off a frenetic first 72 hours of his administration.

TITLE: Russian businessman's Kremlin ties could prove intelligence 'gold mine' for US, former official says
SUMMARY: A Russian businessman who appeared in US court Monday on securities fraud charges could be a valuable asset in US efforts to gather more information on Russian interference in the 2016 election as well as other intelligence operations, former US officials tell CNN.

TITLE: New Hampshire Secretary of State Bill Gardner announces retirement after 45 years as the state's top election official
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Secretary of State Bill Gardner announced Monday that he will be retiring, ending his 45-year run as the state's top election official and the most vocal proponent of New Hampshire's status as the first in the nation primary state.

TITLE: Sheriff says work to find 2 missing people after destructive Colorado wildfire is hard given the heat and debris
SUMMARY: Two people remain missing in Boulder County, Colorado, as authorities work to survey the damage left by a vicious wildfire, the cause of which is under investigation.

How Omicron is ravaging local communities
SUMMARY: Over the weekend, at least five metro Atlanta school districts announced they would shift to remote learning for the first week of the new year as students return to school after a holiday break that saw the Omicron variant spread even further out of control.

TITLE: Abortion providers go back to Supreme Court in long-shot bid to challenge Texas abortion law
SUMMARY: Abortion providers on Monday asked the Supreme Court to require a conservative federal appeals court to return their challenge to Texas' six-week abortion ban to a district court judge who previously ruled in their favor.

TITLE: AMC CEO vows on Twitter to refinance movie theater chain's debt load
SUMMARY: Movie theater chain AMC was a darling of the meme stock crowd in 2021, soaring nearly 1,200% last year thanks to love from rowdy Reddit fans. So what does AMC plan to do for a sequel? For starters, it wants to clean up its balance sheet, which is scarier than a slasher horror film.

TITLE: Biden will make 'brief remarks' Tuesday on rapid spread of the Omicron variant
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Tuesday will make brief remarks addressing the rapid spread of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus in the US and the steps his administration is taking to address it, according to the White House.

TITLE: AT&T and Verizon agree to postpone 5G rollout near airports by 2 weeks
SUMMARY: AT&T and Verizon have agreed to postpone their planned rollouts of 5G infrastructure near airports by two weeks, averting — for now — feared widespread disruptions to air travel and shipping as well as a potential legal battle over the matter.

TITLE: Starbucks unveils its new vaccine policy for workers
SUMMARY: To comply with the Biden administration's upcoming vaccine mandate, Starbucks is requiring its workers to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or undergo weekly testing, the company recently told employees.

TITLE: Tesla just opened a new showroom in China's Xinjiang region
SUMMARY: Tesla has opened a new showroom in Xinjiang, a region in western China that is purported to be the site of abuse and brutal repression of the country's Uyghurs, a predominantly Muslim ethnic minority.

TITLE: 10 of the country's most populous cities set homicide records last year
SUMMARY: More than two-thirds of the country's 40 most populous cities saw more homicides last year than in 2020, according to a CNN analysis of police department data.

TITLE: Federal judge dismisses charges against guards who falsified records the night Jeffrey Epstein died
SUMMARY: A federal judge in New York on Monday dismissed charges against two Bureau of Prisons guards who admitted to falsifying records on the night Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in 2019, court documents show.

Trumps move to quash subpoenas for their testimony in civil investigation
SUMMARY: The New York attorney general's office has subpoenaed two of former President Donald Trump's children for testimony as part of its civil investigation into whether the Trump Organization manipulated the values of its properties.

High cost of food: Will Biden's $1 billion bet  make beef cheaper?
SUMMARY: The White House on Monday offered a solution to surging meat prices: an action plan that includes investing $1 billion of American Rescue Plan funds to boost competition in the industry and promises to ramp up regulation and enforcement of anticompetition laws. But some experts say the move is unlikely to offer relief at the grocery store right away.

TITLE: Evergrande has been ordered to demolish 39 buildings in Chinese resort
SUMMARY: Troubled Chinese real estate developer Evergrande is trying to reassure investors that it will work with authorities who have ordered the company to demolish a few dozen buildings in China.

Hackers breached Florida health care system, potentially exposing data on 1.3 million people
SUMMARY: Hackers breached the computer networks of a southeast Florida health care system in October and may have accessed sensitive personal and financial information on over 1.3 million people, the health care system announced this week.

TITLE: Boom that shook Pittsburgh on New Year's Day was an exploding half-ton meteor, NASA says
SUMMARY: A meteor that caused a loud boom heard in western Pennsylvania on New Year's Day exploded in the atmosphere with a blast equivalent to 30 tons of TNT, NASA said on Monday.

TITLE: Biden's infrastructure czar urges governors to appoint their own infrastructure implementation coordinators
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden's infrastructure czar Mitch Landrieu sent letters to all the nation's governors on Tuesday urging them to appoint their own infrastructure implementation coordinators to smooth the rollout of the $1.2 trillion law.

TITLE: Analysis: What does Marjorie Taylor Greene do all day?
SUMMARY: The news that one of Marjorie Taylor Greene's Twitter accounts has been permanently suspended is a bigger blow to the Georgia Congresswoman than you might think.

TITLE: Analysis: The one Liz Cheney line every Republican should reflect on today
SUMMARY: Nearly a year after rioters sought to overturn the free and fair presidential election of 2020, the Republican Party faces a stark choice -- framed perfectly by Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney on Sunday.

TITLE: Opinion: The Jan. 6 interim report is critical to saving US democracy
SUMMARY: With the anniversary of the January 6 insurrection upon us, we still do not know the full truth about the events that transpired on and led up to that day. While there has been progress toward accountability -- among other things, we at the States United Democracy Center recently filed a lawsuit on behalf of the District of Columbia against the Proud Boys and other conspirators who invaded the Capitol -- overall our democracy may be even more vulnerable than last year.
